page.title: 16Religion
page.content: Before 1941 there were 2 Church of Scotland churches in Cardross. In 1941 Cardross Parish Church was bombed. The Burns Church, built in 1844 through the generosity of Mr. Burns, became the only C of S church in Cardross. The money granted by the government after the war was used to build a complex of church halls. There is also a small Roman Catholic chapel called St.Mayhew. There has been a chapel on this site for hundreds of years. The Burns church, now known as the Parish Church, plays an important role in village life. It is the centre for most of the activities and it is the unit which binds the people together.
